comments.content: No, itâ€™s A. Destination IP address does not change.

questions.answer_description: When a host needs to reach a device on another subnet, the ARP cache entry will be that of the Ethernet address of the local router (default gateway) for the physical MAC address. The destination IP address will not change, and will be that of the remote host (HostB).

discussion.content: The Data Link layer provides the physical transmission of the data and handles error notification, network topology, and flow control. The Data Link layer formats the message into pieces, each called a data frame, and adds a customized header containing the hardware destination and source address. Protocols Data Unit (PDU) on Datalink layer is called frame. According to this question the frame is damaged and discarded which will happen at the Data Link layer.

questions.question_text: A receiving host computes the checksum on a frame and determines that the frame is damaged. The frame is then discarded. At which OSI layer did this happen?

discussion.content: The correct answer is B. Mac address changes on every "hop" while the IP address remains the same.

choices.C: the MAC address of the server network interface
choices.B: the MAC address of router interface e1
choices.D: the MAC address of host A
choices.A: the MAC address of router interface e0

comments.content: No answer is C. If no OSPF ROuter ID is configured the highest Loopback Interface IP will be selected. IF no Loopback is Configured the highest active interface IP will be used.

choices.B: Spanning-tree will need to be used.
choices.D: The connection between switches should be a trunk.
choices.A: This design will function as intended.
choices.E: The router interfaces must be encapsulated with the 802.1Q protocol.
choices.C: The router will not accept the addressing scheme.

discussion.content: I have a question. If it were 192.168.1.1 and 192.168.2.1 it could be B?
Router won't accept that addressing scheme because each router's active interface must be in a different subnetwork
